Content:: The Earth Sciences Museum (Museu de Ciências da Terra) is a geological museum in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. The building was part of the National Exposition of Brazil in 1908. Its collection includes minerals,[1] fossils, and geological exhibits. The building was constructed in 1907[2] for the National Exposition of Brazil and was intended to be permanent. At the exposition it was the States Pavilion.[3][4] 22°57′13″S 43°10′14″W﻿ / ﻿22.9536°S 43.1706°W﻿ / -22.9536; -43.1706Coordinates: 22°57′13″S 43°10′14″W﻿ / ﻿22.9536°S 43.1706°W﻿ / -22.9536; -43.1706 This article related to a museum in Brazil is a stub.
